trend: Bill Gates Pledges Fortune to Global Health Initiatives
summary: On May 8, 2025, during the 25th anniversary of the Gates Foundation, Bill Gates announced plans to give away his fortune, raising major implications for global healthcare. The Foundation currently works towards three principal goals: eliminating preventable deaths among mothers and babies, eradicating infectious diseases, and eliminating poverty. Gates' decision to divest his personal wealth signals a potential shift in funding strategies, leaving stakeholders to consider the future pathways for sustaining progress in global health.
source title: Bill Gates to give away his fortune: What it means for global healthcare

summary: Mounting tariffs are triggering concerns across healthcare organizations grappling with already thin margins. Even marginal increases in supply chain costs, particularly for critical items like anesthesia and other pharmaceuticals, could erode the financial sustainability of healthcare providers.
source title: Health care industry trend watch: Week of April 28, 2025

trend: AI in Healthcare Market Projected to Reach $24.18 Billion
summary: The artificial intelligence in healthcare market size has grown exponentially in recent years. It will grow from $18.16 billion in 2024 to $24.18 billion in 2025 at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 33.2%. The growth is driven by increasing implementation of AI in radiology, cost-efficient drug discovery, and rising funding in AI healthcare.
source title: Artificial Intelligence In Healthcare Global Market Report

trend: Global Regulators Prioritize Climate Risk Assessment
summary: On May 12, 2025, the global oversight body of banking regulators agreed to prioritize the assessment and management of financial risks related to climate change. The Basel Committee on Banking Supervision announced plans to release a voluntary disclosure framework for climate-related financial risks to guide national regulators. While the committee lacks enforcement power, its standards strongly influence global banking regulations.
source title: Global banking regulators agree to prioritise climate risk work

trend: U.S. Banking Sector Advocates for Easing Leverage Rules
summary: The U.S. banking industry is urging regulators to reform the Supplementary Leverage Ratio (SLR), a post-financial crisis rule requiring banks to hold capital even against low-risk assets like Treasury bonds. Regulatory bodies, including the Federal Reserve, FDIC, and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, are considering adjustments, such as exempting Treasuries and central bank deposits or modifying the 'enhanced' SLR applicable to large banks.
source title: Banking sector says easing U.S. leverage rules could support Treasury market

trend: Asian Banks Experience Boost Amid Currency Rally
summary: A rally in Asian currencies, led by the Taiwan dollar and followed by currencies from China, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Singapore, and South Korea, is strengthening Asian banks' wealth management and forex services. This shift is partly due to rising demand for local currency-denominated assets as investors move away from U.S. dollar assets amid heightened trade tariff uncertainties.
source title: Asian banks see big boost to wealth business as currencies rally
